quest.name: Shaken Resolve
journal: Tataru seems eager to make up for lost time.

Tataru's obvious relief at your presence soon gives way to chattiness, and she wastes no time apprising you of recent events. It would seem the fighting at the Ghimlyt Dark has ceased, and that nothing else of any great import has happened in your absence. Wishing to take advantage of this relative lull in activity, she invites you to tell her of your adventures in the First, the mention of which reminds her that F'lhaminn is also eager to know what became of Minfilia. With this in mind, she bids you wait for her on the terrace at the House of Splendors.

Tataru and F'lhaminn hang on your every word as you tell them of the First, of Minfilia's sacrifice, and of the young girl Ryne who now carries on her legacy. Before you can continue, however, an unexpected guest arrives─Riol. Tataru had hoped he would bring word from her helper behind enemy lines, but he has apparently received no communication of any kind. Fearing the worst, Riol is resolved to sneak into the Empire himself in the hopes he might finally make contact. Before taking his leave, however, he remembers to tell you that Krile has come to the Rising Stones. She apparently wishes to speak with you about the plight of your friends marooned in the First.

Krile enters the main hall, offering a greeting absent the cheerful tones to which you are accustomed. She has, you learn, just finished an examination of the stricken Scions, confirming suspicions she had hoped would prove false─the tenuous link between their bodies and their souls is weakening. Time is of the essence, and thus she bids you return to the First to inform the others of your discovery. While you do so, she will consult Master Matoya on a means to maintain the stability of their corporeal aether for as long as possible.

Your comrades seem unsurprised by Krile's findings, but the gravity of the situation is not lost on them. After a brief discussion, they settle upon a novel solution: to pour their spirits into auracite, theoretically enabling you to bear them safely across the rift and back to the Source as you would inanimate possessions. This will, however, require knowledge of soul preservation and transference, subjects wholly unfamiliar to all present. Luckily, the Crystal Exarch may know of someone who can help.
objectives: Speak with F'lhaminn at the House of Splendors.
Speak with Tataru at the Rising Stones.
Speak with the Crystal Exarch in the Ocular.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename! Gods, it's good to see you. I hope your being here means you've had your fill of rest?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: More than my fill!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Not so much as forty winks, truth be told...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well, you've certainly earned it.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You're too selfless, that's your problem. But you'll be no good to anyone if you don't take a break every once in a while. Anyway...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Not much has happened since your last visit. I had planned for you to meet that helper I told you about, but he refuses to answer his linkpearl. I do hope he's all right.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We've been exchanging messages with the Eorzean Alliance throughout, though. They say the fighting has finally stopped at the Ghimlyt Dark, and that the Empire's shown no sign of movement.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Which means we might actually have a moment to ourselves for a change. Seeing as you're back, maybe you could tell me more about your time in the First?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Great! Oh, and if you don't mind, I'd like to ask F'lhaminn to join us. She'll want to know what happened to Minfilia, and I think it's best she hears it from you.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We'll meet you on the terrace at the House of Splendors.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have now begun “The Voyage Home.” To proceed to the end of this chapter, you must complete the Crystal Tower quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Crystal Tower quests can be experienced alongside the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The starting quest, “Legacy of Allag,” may be undertaken by speaking with the outlandish man in Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may review your progress under “Chronicles of a New Era - The Crystal Tower” in your journal.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We'll be waiting for you at the House of Splendors. And I expect you to tell us absolutely everything about your time in the First!

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Forename. My, it has been too long. Tataru did mention that I would be joining you, did she not?

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Thank you... Words cannot well express how I have longed to know more of the First. This world Minfilia has sacrificed so much to save.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: But come, rest your feet. Tataru should be arriving shortly.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: And so Minfilia chose to pass on her gifts to the next Oracle? This girl who Thancred named Ryne?

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: To have such a burden thrust upon her as a child...only to embrace it when given the choice...

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: In that respect, they are quite alike. It would seem her legacy is indeed in capable hands.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Forename─might I ask a favor of you when next you return to the First? To tell Ryne what I cannot.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: To tell her...thank you.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: And I would offer thanks to you as well. For staying with her to the end.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: (-???-)Beggin' yer pardon, but could I have a word?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Riol! I hope you're here to tell me you've received word from our helper.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: I wish. Nay, I've not had a peep out of him. An' it's been a good long while now. Too bloody long.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: On account o' which, I'm goin' to sneak over the border an' see if I can't get a signal to him from closer up.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: But what if they catch you!? There must be another way.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Well, it ain't as if we can ask Thancred to do it. Besides, I shouldn't have no trouble pickin' me way through Ghimlyt now the fightin's died down. Gods know there's enough shadows to hide in.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: An' it beats waitin' 'round here twiddlin' me thumbs. Anyroad, I just thought I'd let ye know. Now, I'd best be─

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Ack! I nearly forgot! Krile's at the Stones, an' she wants a word.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Somethin' to do with the patients. She was gettin' ready to examine 'em again when I left.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We'd best head back, then. I'm sure it's important.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: You needn't worry about me. Go and see what Krile has to say.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: It seems she's still examining them. Oh, I do hope it's nothing bad...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Take care over in the First, Forename. We're counting on you and the Crystal Exarch to bring our friends home.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Don't you worry. Master Matoya and I will think of something.

dialogue.name: EPHEMIE
dialogue.text: Tataru has apprised us of the Archons' condition. Rest assured, we will do our utmost to assist Mistress Krile in her ministrations.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you are returned. I hope your time in the Source was suitably restful?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: ...But of course it wasn't. Go on...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Their corporeal aether shows signs of instability? By the gods... The possibility never even occurred to me...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: If you have returned in the hope that my research has yielded a solution, I fear you will be sorely disappointed.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: 'Tis but a mercy we have the likes of Mistress Krile and Master Matoya to keep our friends' bodies safe while we wrestle with the problem.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: But they cannot forestall the separation of body and soul indefinitely. Come, the others must be told.
